PARAGRAPH.STRING: (4,327 m) is a mountain in the Pennine Alps in Switzerland.
is the highest point on the Nadelgrat, a high-level ridge running roughly northâ€“south above the resort of Saas-Fee to the east, and the Mattertal to the west.
three ridges join to form a sharp-pointed summit, which looks like a needle (German: Nadel) when seen from the north.
was first climbed by Franz Andenmatten, Baptiste Epiney, Aloys Supersaxo and J. Zimmermann on 16 September 1858.
